page.title: 01Olney, Emberton & Clifton Re
page.content: The Ouse, meanders between the market town of Olney - famous for its annual pancake race against Liberal, USA - and the villages of Emberton and Clifton Reynes. The outskirts of Newton Blossomville, the hamlet of Petsoe End and scattered farms form the only other settlements. The east is predominantly agricultural land with mixed farming an the clay fields which slope to the gravel terraces along the river. The local limestone is to be seen in all older buildings. Emberton Park with its series of lakes was the first such country park; created by landscaping a site following gravel extraction for the M1. People travel to work in Milton Keynes, Northampton, Bedford and further afield. There is employment in Olney in shops, businesses and light industry. Olney's association
